title: Photon properties - momentum of 5e17 Hz photon

content.question: What is the magnitude of the momentum of a photon that has a frequency of <math alttext="5.0 times 10 to the seventeenth power hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>17</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Hz</mtext></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.1 times 10 raised to the negative 24 power kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>24</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>

<math alttext="2.2 times 10 raised to the negative 24 power kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>24</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>

<math alttext="3.3 times 10 raised to the negative 16 power kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>

<math alttext="6.0 times 10 raised to the negative 10 power kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.1 times 10 raised to the negative 24 power kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>24</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
